moves.5... exd4 6. Nxd4 Ne5:
I hate it when white plays Bxf7 ; Kxf7; Ng5 . As that would leave me crippled. 
Hence, why I played exd4 moving (relocating) White's f3 knight. The e5 knight protects my f7 pawn and attacks White's c4 bishop.
moves.7. Be2: Retreating the bishop giving me tempo. Better was Bb3
moves.7... Be7: Now the point of the pirc's defense is of the hypermordern origin. Black concedes to the center. Allowing white to build up an ideal pawn center and controlling the central squares. While black develops his minor pieces so as to  later undermine whites pawn chain. Black waits and provokes white to attack premature. I prefer Be7 to g6; Bg7
moves.9. f4: Provoking white to attack premature if you will
moves.9... Ng6 10. Be3 O-O 11. Qd3 c6: This is the start of my attack. White attacks my king side with a pawn storm, while I position my pieces. I evade my opponent ; Defend and attack him head on, toe to toe. Unlike the Sicilian where black counter attacks on the queen side and Ruy Lopez where black creates a queen side pawn storm.
moves.12. h3: !! hindering my f3 knight movements and preparing g4
moves.12... d5:
Now I have formed my second pawn chain. The first was c7; d6; e5.  This new pawn chain b7; c6; d5 opens up my cramped position and forms my defensive barrier.Evade! Defend! Position! Attack! 
Modern chess theory states that you attack where you pawn chain points, the King side.
